number of helpful: 45 of 54 people (83%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 27, 2016
												To clarify: you don't need to pay to enjoy this game. In game cash (non-purchaseable) can be used for transfers, stadium upgrades and everything else you'd expect. I think the majority of negative reviews are from people who have seen that players CAN be bought with credits, but haven't stayed in the game long enough to see that you can buy them with IG funds aswell. So again, this game can be played and enjoyed WITHOUT paying. Now for the actual review: This is a free game, so limit what you actually expect from it. Agreed, it looks like the Championship Manager games from the last decade, but what can you expect - it's free! You want a nice UI and tons of in-depth features? Stop being cheap and get Football Manager (or other purchaseable alternatives). My review is positive not because i will sink hundreds of hours into it, or because it's a sophisticated management simulation, but because it's a free game with full 2016-2017 squads, it has a functioning UI, is stable, and has enough features to be an enjoyable jump-in experience for an hour at a time. If you want 10+ hours of enjoyment, you're going to need to invest in an alternative. But don't complain that it's impossible to play without paying - you're wrong. Ignore the negative reviews that only cite this one issue.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2016
												Great game. Some say it's pay to win but it isn't actually. Ok, there is options to pay with real money but it's not like you MUST in order to play the game. With real money you can get more cash for your choosen team and buy any player you want instantly but.. where's fun in that? Isn't all about having fun and challenge and see how good you are in management? Personally didn't spend a coin on this game and these are my best achievements: In 3 seasons I managed to get into CL final with Croatian side Dinamo Zagreb(players rank 82-88), on the way to beating teams like Bayern, Atl.Madrid, Chelsea and losing in final 4-2 to Real Madrid cuz of individual quality. In 3 seasons I won La Liga with Celta Vigo(players rank 85-91). In 2 seasons finished second in Seria A with Sampdoria(players rank 84-90) and won Coppa Italia. Currently in 2nd season with Southampton(players rank 86-92) trying to win Premier League. You don't need best ranked players, you can make your own through training and matches. So you only need some time to find out best tactics and be smart enough to use it. And sometimes, you need luck, ofc :). That's it from me, now excuse me, going to put fingers on ice

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6
												Personally, I only think a few tweaks to the game would make it a better game imo. Most of these aren't too big a deal, but one is kinda frustrating that I haven't seen brought up. (And yes, I spent too much time on this game, but that isn't the point)The only major thing is crosses and long shots. With crosses, 9/10 they'll fumble into the net and you'll wonder how they didn't save it, as they always seem to go over the keeper, no matter who they are (I've done this to Petr Cech) and long shots, I mean halfway line/Byline "Shots" That the keeper hits into his own net. If there is a way to fix that then that's the main annoying part I found gone. Just quickly, a few things I think would be nice for the game, for example sackings, or the board expectations are pointless, making the game harder (I got Dumbarton up to the Scottish Prem and won it in 4 seasons, with two cups along the way) and the board updating their expectations after a season (I know I said that it is pointless, but avoid relegation, get a 6 place finish in a 10 team league, and win the league next season?)But like I said, the only main problem is the Crosses/Long shots, but it's just what I think needs improving.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2016
												I'm going to start off by saying that this game is much better than I thought it would be.I played Soccer Manager 2015 and 2016 and I wasn't entirely impressed by them. I felt they were lacking and had a few problems that seem to have been worked out. *Note - This isn't anything close to how Football Manager is, so don't go in expecting that.I'm currently playing the game as a placeholder I suppose for the lack of a better name until Football Manager 2017 comes out. You can start off with any team you want. Player ratings are done a bit weird, but it isn't a big deal. For the most part, transfer budgets are fairly small (about 20ish million). That budget is the norm for all big teams as far as I know. You can purchase 'Cash Injections' but you really don't need too, it is very easy to make money (Raise youth players and sell them, bring in players on free transfers and sell them, sell fringe players, etc. If you're losing money every month then that means you have a player who has a very large wage and you don't have enough cash so becareful of that.) The game does 1 thing that I've seen never before in Football Manager: Players arrive late for training and don't perform well. I thought that was a cool and interesting feature, and funny when it was Nicklas Bendtner that did it.Games go by very quick, not much to them. Pick one of the few formations available, set few tactics, and you can assign player roles. All games are done on a 2D match engine. I'd love to see a 3D match engine.Transfer tips: Sign Christian Pulisic and take a look at the free transfers, you can get Martin Caceres and Alex on a free in the first season and some other decent mid to high 80 players.I'd love to see the microtransactions disappear. I wouldn't mind spending 10 - 15 bucks on this game to have no microtransactions and a 3D match engine.One last thing, I'd also love to see a redesigned UI and more information on players and clubs, in similar fashion to Football Manager.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 10, 2016
												This game is fun and almost perfect however there are a few key things that prevent it from being as fun as it should be.          1. Red cards are a big issue, you can barely go a game without getting one and whenever you do your player is suspended for 3 games instead of 1, so a simple tweak to fix the red cards given and the punishment length should be easy.2. Transfers are always losses, when you put a player up for sale no matter how old or how talented the other clubs try to pay you so much less than they are worth and will not budge any more than 250,000 however when you try and buy players from other clubs you are required to pay much more than they are worth so I suppose it prevents people from making millions and buying OP teams so that you can get more tokens purchased but seriously having to sell players for 2 million and then buying a player who if you every sold would probably sell for half his price is just unfair.3. Other transfer issues, a strange issue with the transfers is that even after the window closes you can still sell your players and make money so that at the next opening you have some money. However I feel like this makes the game a little too easy if you just sell all of your reserve players to buy one good player at the transfer opening.I would say that overall this game is amazing and very fun but just those few small tweaks and the game is all set!

content:
Posted: October 5, 2016
												Terrible. I don't like the idea of writing a review after such little time but I can't see myself even giving this game a chance. For starters, the UI is a mess. Nothing is organized, the design is dirt cheap, and it runs like a laggy flash game. You can tell there was literally no effort put into this. Nothing is where you expect it to be, you can't do simple things like click back or forwards through pages, all of the symbols and icons are poor choices. You can barely read player ratings. Trying to judge players is more work than it should be. There are so many choices but I feel like there really is no strategy or depth to the game in any way. In the first two games I played with two seperate clubs, my players received 3 red cards. "????????" The game is loaded with upgrade options that can be bought with coins so I see why what the scheme here is: put literally zero effort into game development, label it a free Football Manager, then try to sucker in cash through a coin system.

number of helpful: 29 of 69 people (42%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 16, 2016
												Soccer Manager 2017 has been released and I am writing this review on 9/16/2016The current team I'm managing with this simulator is Borussia Dortmund.This manager game for the sport of Soccer/Football includes many leagues with real team logos and real player names and portraits, no mods needed.This game allows you to select a team from your desired league and manage the players and the club to try to win games and cups.You start with the real life list of players and can sell/buy new players.The simulation seems fine, with tactical changes affecting the game.PROS AND CONS:Pros - FREE Football ManagerGood UIRuns smoothlyEasy to learnReal players and clubsReal icons with no need for modsGood simulationCons - You can inject cash and buy players with "coins"Cash is hard to come by - You lose more than you make without spending real moneyGames are pre-determined. I tested this out by saving and then re-loading the game, the fixtures will always come out the same no matter what.It seems like fouls come too easy in this game, even on softer tackling. Once again, pre-determined games ruin the immersion.OVERALL -Good Soccer/Football manager for someone who can't spend any moneyIf you have the money to buy a football manager, it is 10x better than this game at the moment.I will give this game a positive rating since it works as intended and I believe for the person who doesn't want to spend money, this game will be satisfactory. TL;DR - Good game, good simulation. Pre-determined matches and coin buying ruins it for me, but may not be a problem for other people. Pick it up and try it out for yourself.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 18, 2016
												My very first Review on Steam, and then of course a review that does not recommend the game. Initially, the game was fun. Not too many things to decide, but enough things to decide. However, I think it is important that the player has or gets an idea of the effect his decisions make. I was rarely sure if I did things right or not.Watching and influencing the games was fun, buying and selling players is also well implemented. On my system, there seemed to be some bugs left, mainly with respect to Appearance and User interaction. Until here I would have recommended the game.Reasons I don't recommend this game for: 1. This is to some degree a pay-to-win game. I never understand why those games are popular. If I want some money in-game because I want to buy a player, I want to get a loan that I can pay back. Here, I have to buy the in-game currency with real money. What challenge is that? If I spend 100 Euros, I can buy the best players, be at the top and make the game boring. If I spend 0 Euros, it will be hard to win?! 2. What made me really angry is: After one season the game failed to save my game. For the third time and now almost 30 minutes, I try to resume my saved game. No success. OK, that may happen. But can I go back to an older save game? No, I can't because you only get one slot, except - you might have guessed - you spend real money and buy another one. Crazy. Free the game of that In-game shopping crap, and I will spend ~15 Euros and buy it. But not like this.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 22, 2016
												It is the only free football manager to choose. It is hard and unpredictible, save game can come to hand. You have to win cups and leagues if you want to survive, unless money drains and you can close the club. Sometimes defensive tactic make 3:0 and offensive tactics on the same duel (save/load game) makes 1:6. Too many statistics that are not so good overlooked, there are a little action that can help you with money, win the games and sell players. Need academy and training place, after 2 years in game you can sell young players - necessary to survive. Buy only young players with high target skills (talents) use manager experience to buy some attacker on hotspot in store - helps you to win even in european league.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 26
												Very good game in my opinion. Easy to play once you get the hang of it. I manage to play and sign players just fine without spending any money on SM credits. All you need to do is win matches and leagues and use that prize money to purchase whatever players or facility upgrade you require.The only problem i seem to have is that occasionally, seeing that i play this game on different devices including the steam version and the mobile app version, sometimes the saved game would be out of date and i would therefore have to replay the matches and regain the progress which wouldnt have been transferred to the other device. Signing out and signing in again sometimes helps fix this though.  Overall i think it is a very good game, fun to play. I highly recommend you at least give it a try, you might like it as many others do.

												For a free football simulator, it's great. However, there are a few bugs that are still in the game from last year which do get a bit annoying over time (i.e. at the start of the half, if you want to play in short highlights, you have to hit play then go to the first tab and quickly switch back). Without that it is a great game.
